author: Lattermild
title: My first Mixel
review:
There are a lot of interesting parts here, hardly any that I don't already see the use for in other builds. And the resulting figure is pretty adorable. The one thing I would have liked to see improved is the way the legs are hinged. Though the ball joints have a fairly wide range of movements, the placement does not allow for very "walkable" poses (jumps are another matter entirely, they work great for that).

I'm quite sure we will be buying more Mixels, though, there is quite a lot of fun in that little (cheap) bag.

author: Trigger_
title: Alright Mixel. Good Set
review:
First, there are still some positives: I really love the use of the craggy rock piece and warm golden cheese slopes which give him a lot of character. However, there is some stuff wrong:

  • Least articulate of Series 1.
  • I AM following up from the previous point, but hinged arms.
  • The golden crystal trophy is too common compared to the Golden Chi which was originally going to be in it.
  • The mouth (if you can call it that) is unexpressive.

Still better than Seismo.
